name: JavaToolInstaller
description: Acquire a specific version of Java from a user-supplied Azure blob or the tool cache and sets JAVA_HOME
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=875287) or [see the Java documentation](https://docs.oracle.com/java/)
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: JavaInAzureGroup
groups.displayName: Download Java from an Azure blob

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: JDK version
inputs.helpMarkDown: A number that specifies the JDK version to make available on the path. Use a whole number version, such as 10

inputs.name: jdkArchitectureOption
inputs.label: JDK architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The architecture (x86, x64) of the JDK.

inputs.name: jdkFile
inputs.label: JDK file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to where the compressed JDK is located. The path could be in your source repository or a local path on the agent.

inputs.name: azureResourceManagerEndpoint
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the JDK.

inputs.name: azureStorageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage account name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager storage accounts are listed. Select the storage account name in which the JDK is located.

inputs.name: azureContainerName
inputs.label: Container name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in the storage account in which the JDK is located.

inputs.name: azureCommonVirtualFile
inputs.label: Common virtual path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the JDK inside the Azure storage container.

inputs.name: jdkDestinationDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: On Linux and Windows, this is used as the destination directory for JDK installation. On macOS, this directory is used as a temporary folder for extracting of .dmg's since macOS doesn't support installing of JDK to specific directory.

inputs.name: cleanDestinationDirectory
inputs.label: Clean destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to clean the destination directory before JDK is extracted into it.

inputs.name: createExtractDirectory
inputs.label: Create directory for extracting
inputs.helpMarkDown: By default, task is creating a directory similar to this JAVA_HOME_8_X64_OpenJDK_zip for extracting JDK. This option allows to disable creation of this folder, in this case, JDK will be located in the root of jdkDestinationDirectory
